intro: Calymmodon persimilis, commonly known as the slender thistle, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features a slender, spiny stem and lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture. Its flowers are typically yellow and are arranged in a single head, often surrounded by bracts. Calymmodon persimilis is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
